drug.name: Magaldrate
drug.description: Magaldrate is an antacid drug used for the treatment of esophagitis, duodenal and gastric ulcers, and gastroesophageal reflux. Magaldrate has been discontinued in the US market.

article.citation: Kurtz W: [A layered lattice antacid with long-term effectiveness. Profile of action and safety exemplified by magaldrate]. Fortschr Med. 1993 Feb 28;111(6):93-6.

Varas Lorenzo MJ, Lopez Martinez A, Gordillo Bernal J, Mundet Surroca J: [Comparative study of 3 drugs (aceglutamide aluminum, zinc acexamate, and magaldrate) in the long-term maintenance treatment (1 year) of peptic ulcer]. Rev Esp Enferm Dig. 1991 Aug;80(2):91-4.

drug.route-of-elimination:
Aluminium oxide: absorbed Al ions are eliminated in the urine (0.1-0.5 mg of Al in aluminium-containing antacid is absorbed from standard daily doses of antacid) while insoluble or poorly absorbed Al salts in the intestines are excreted through the feces.
Magnesium oxide: absorbed Mg ions (up to 30%) are eliminated in the urine, unabsorbed is excreted in the feces.

atc-code.level: Combinations and complexes of aluminium, calcium and magnesium compounds
